physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient is a 24-year-old female with absent breast development, primary amenorrhea, and multicystic ovaries. She presents with markedly elevated serum estrogen levels and mildly elevated gonadotropins.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient has had no breast development and the multicystic ovarian condition persists without abdominal pain.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: LH and FSH were above norms for the early follicular phase. Seven pulses of LH detected within the sampling period with an interpulse interval of 58.3 +/- 19.4 min.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The frequency of LH pulses and their amplitude suggest an ongoing dysfunction due to estrogen insensitivity.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On norethindrone treatment, ovarian volume decreased from 123.7 cm3 to 10.5 cm3, and estradiol decreased from 1910 pg/ml to 47 pg/ml.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Mean ovarian volume was consistently elevated over eight years, but treatment led to significant reductions in both ovarian volume and estradiol levels.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Continued reduction in bone mineral density with z-scores reflecting pronounced osteopenia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Z-scores at age 15 were -2.4, indicating progressively worsening bone density over time.
